First off, you sound cool (ever in northern Indiana hit me up) Start disk golfing, really easy to make friends with people there. It's not odd to do it alone (happens a lot) and it's common to get invited to a larger group. It usually takes place in parks. Go to a movie rental place and chat with the people that work there, you might make friends that way. Just do the things you like alone until you find some other people doing it, then do it with them.
This happened to me with a guy, turns out he just didn't have a car but had a huge crush on me and was hoping to keep me on the back burner until he got a car.

There is actually a trick to cologne.
Blue: every day
Green: clubs/parties where you're active
Brown: weddings and that kind of thing
Anything in glass that's a minimum of $30 is going to be fine. Just choose what you like best.

All we really are, are the stories we carry around with us. Don't shy away from something because the story might be bad, they can't all be good after all.

I really do wish you all the best. He was probably just being an idiot and doesn't know how to explain that. He probably just wasn't entirely in the mood for sex and thought he would get into it but you know that sometimes you just want to go without. He may have been trying to be sweet and keep it going for you but then his mind began to wonder and he thought he could sneak in an email because he's an idiot, like we all are. I'm not saying don't be mad at him, be mad at him, definitely be mad at him but you could use this moment to bring your relationship closer instead of drive it father apart. You're hurt and he knows he's in the wrong, you feel used and mistreated. He doesn't know how to explain himself and is thinking about how much he fucked up. Right now is not the time to put up a wall, you need to tear them down. Yell at eachother, cry together and fall in love. You have a chance to be completely honest with him, use it.
Ps: since my last comment I've had wine and I've been thinking about how lonely I am lol so take my advice with that in mind...though he's still an ass, but who doesn't love an ass right?

WRITING.TITLE: I'm drinking wine lonely in the bathtub surrounded by candle lights but everything is going to be fine.
WRITING.TEXT:
Now before you picture some fancy ass guy here please know that I bought both the candles and wine on clearance and I can hardly fit in my tiny apartment bathtub (actually I think the tub is normal sized I'm just 6'4"). I keep making stupid decisions, I choose guys for the wrong reasons and when I choose right I'm constantly terrified that I'm about to loose them. Then the actions I take to keep them from leaving end up driving them away. I grew up in s trailer park and spent most of my life moving from apartment to apartment. I went to college for applied mathematics and finished the course program in December but I still need to pay them $1000 and take a test to pass out of Spanish so I can get the degree. I don't speak Spanish but I can't afford to take the class so I need to pass out. I work at a Walmart where I hate myself and do as little work as possible. My new boss hates me and her bosses have never liked me. I have two places where I'm trying to get a job and I'm waiting to hear back on both. I live pay check to pay check with no savings and very little food in my kitchen. I try to stay away from home as much as possible so it just gets dirty. My apartment stoped being my sanctuary and became the place where I sleep and fuck. I'm not over my ex. He broke up with me on my birthday. I don't know why but I can guess at a couple reasons. I used to be over 300 lbs but I've lost a lot of it. I still see a fat piece of shit in the mirror but everyone tells me otherwise. I see these guys I date and feel guilty, like I've conned them into going out with me. It's not all bad though. I started painting in January and I love it. I rekindled a friendship and removed a toxic person from my life. Just joined a gym, I'm going to go through with getting healthier (promise to myself). I met a guy and went on a nice date with him. I'm hoping we can keep doing this and I for once in my bloody life didn't fuck him on the first date...there was plenty of play and blowing but no dick in ass (that's a big accomplishment for me). I usually fuck early on because I'm good at it and feel like these guys are lowering themselves to be with me do I have to show them their money's worth. I never put that into words before...damn I'm a bit pathetic lol Even though I think I look like shit I know that I'm decently handsome and I have one hell of a wit. My personality has to be alright or I wouldn't have so many people like me. But for some reason I feel like I'm sinking. There is something wrong with me that's pulling me deeper and deeper into despair. I still get happy and feel close with people but there is something lurking there under the surface waiting to pull me under. I know I have it pretty good and that I shouldn't complain but I really want to complain right now. I want to read your replies. God only knows if I'll comment on them but I really like reading when someone who doesn't know me tries to help. I think it's because I have this air of manipulation about me, I feel like everyone who is my friend and that knows me has been tricked into it. My closest friends don't like me too much but that's ok, we built our friendships not off of liking eachother. I posted some pictures in the comments as a way to sucker you all into giving me compliments lol
To:dr I'm hosting a pity party and want your attention so I stop feeling lonely.

Picture yourself five years from now. You've gone to college and have all new friends; you've gained a new kind of relationship with your parents, more of a friendship. Then picture yourself at a beach bonfire with your friends and think 'is this a story I'd be ok telling'. If it is then go for it, if it isn't then still feel free going for it but remember one day you may be ashamed of these actions.

I tend to give longwinded advice that is supposed to help you come to your own decisions but this time I'm going to start with my opinion of what you should do. You should break up. Break up in a nice way, do it gently and make sure you're financially independent. Tell him that you wanted to make things work and you'd like to try again but there are things that need to change and we can't change them while together. I'm sorry bro

Tell him that you don't know how to describe your feelings yet. That you care about him so deeply and that hearing him say I love you made feel the same bitter flies in your stomach you felt with your first kiss. Tell him your favorite things about him, mention the little things he does without even noticing. Just keep telling him these things and say to him. "I care about you deeply and I want to use love to describe you when I'm sure, far beyond sure. Like the old couple that gets married and wonder why they didn't do it sooner. I want to make sure my deceleration to you is without the slightest hesitation."

Play with his hair, hold his arms down. Do anything on this list that turns you on ;)
